objectives: Students will be able to discuss food and dining out using appropriate vocabulary
Students will practice asking and answering questions about the topic
Students will express personal opinions and experiences related to the topic
Students will improve fluency through extended speaking practice
can_do_statements: Understand main points of clear standard input on familiar matters
Deal with most situations while traveling

warm_up.description: Students think about their experiences with food and dining out, discuss with a partner, then share with the class
instructions: Give students 1 minute to think individually
Pair students and have them discuss for 3 minutes
Invite volunteers to share interesting points with the class

main_activities.title: Role-play: Food and Dining Out
procedure: Introduce the activity and model if necessary
Divide students into pairs or small groups
Monitor and provide support as needed

procedure: Introduce the activity and model if necessary
Divide students into pairs or small groups
Monitor and provide support as needed

main_activities.title: Picture description: Food and Dining Out
procedure: Introduce the activity and model if necessary

discussion_questions: What do you think about food and dining out?
Can you describe your experience with food and dining out?
How important is food and dining out in your life?
What are the advantages of food and dining out?
Have you ever had a problem with food and dining out?
Would you recommend food and dining out to others? Why?
How has food and dining out changed over time?
What would you like to learn about food and dining out?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: At a food and dining out event
role_play_scenarios.situation: Person A asks Person B for advice and information

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Planning related to food and dining out

disagreeing: I see what you mean, but...
That's not how I see it

pronunciation_focus.focus: Word stress and intonation in questions

extension_activities: Watch a video about food and dining out and summarize the main points
Write a blog post about your opinion on food and dining out
Interview someone about their experience with food and dining out

homework.task: Prepare a 2-3 minute presentation about food and dining out
requirements: Use at least 5 vocabulary items from the lesson

assessment_criteria.fluency: Can maintain conversation with some hesitation
assessment_criteria.accuracy: Uses basic structures with reasonable accuracy
assessment_criteria.vocabulary: Has sufficient vocabulary for familiar topics

teacher_notes.preparation: Review key vocabulary and concepts related to food and dining out
anticipated_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge on this topic
Students may need encouragement to speak at length
differentiation: Provide sentence starters for less confident students
Offer more complex discussion questions for advanced students
Allow use of dictionaries during preparation time
teacher_notes.cultural_considerations: Be aware of cultural sensitivities related to food and dining out
teacher_notes.follow_up: Monitor student progress and provide individual feedback

methodology: Communicative Language Teaching (CLT) with Task-Based Learning
